biotools.summary: The Progenetix database provides an overview of copy number abnormalities in human cancer from currently 113322 array and chromosomal Comparative Genomic Hybridization (CGH) experiments, as well as Whole Genome or Whole Exome Sequencing (WGS, WES) studies. The cancer profile data in Progenetix was curated from 1600 articles and represents 420 and 542 different cancer types, according to the International classification of Diseases in Oncology (ICD-O) and NCIt "neoplasm" classification, respectively. Additionally, the website attempts to identify and present all publications (currently 3962 articles), referring to cancer genome profiling experiments.
